body:
Hello @logic03, thank you for your interest in our work! Please visit our [Custom Training Tutorial](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/Train-Custom-Data) to get started, and see our [Google Colab Notebook](https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1G8T-VFxQkjDe4idzN8F-hbIBqkkkQnxw), [Docker Image](https://hub.docker.com/r/ultralytics/yolov3), and [GCP Quickstart Guide](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/GCP-Quickstart) for example environments. 
  
If this is a bug report, please provide screenshots and **minimum viable code to reproduce your issue**, otherwise we can not help you.

@logic03 it's an augmentation technique we invented which results in improved AP on COCO.

You can train without it by doing `python3 train.py --rect`

issue.title: Question about mosaic

repository.name: yolov3
repository.description: YOLOv3 in PyTorch > ONNX > CoreML > TFLite

issue.body: I want to ask about "Mosaic", what is the principle and advantage of this data enhancement method? Do you have any relevant articles or materials?

body:
@NaeemKhan333 if you want to train without the mosaic loader simply run
`python3 train.py --rect`

@NaeemKhan333 yes this correct, this helps improve mAP in COCO and on most datasets. You can try training without the mosaic loader also to compare:
`python3 train.py --rect`

@glenn-jocher I have trained model without mosaic loader using following command

```
python3 train.py --rect
```

But Training with Mosaic Loader has given much better accuracy than training without mosaic, but It causing few false detections. I have a single class and have 5000 training images and 500 testing images, but it causing a few false detections. I have used yolov3-spp-ultralytics, with predefined parameters and other settings  What could be the reason for false detection?

@NaeemKhan333 you choose your own rate of FPs by varying the `--conf` threshold:

`python3 detect.py --conf 0.9`

@glenn-jocher I cannot understand " choose your own rate of FPs" and mostly the score for detection, I get is in between 0.4-->0.8 range, But some time false detection also gets a higher score like 0.6,0.65,0.7, which is strange for me.

You choose how many false positives you want by varying the confidence threshold.

The higher you increase —conf the less FPs you’ll see.
This issue is stale because it has been open 30 days with no activity. Remove Stale label or comment or this will be closed in 5 days.
